# Sidney Spit Ferry Service Tender Announcement

## Solicitation Information

* **Title**: Sidney Spit Ferry Service – Gulf Islands National Park Reserve, BC
* **Reference Number**: 5P420-23-0378/A
* **Publication Date**: May 7, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date**: May 29, 2024, 4:00 PM (EST)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: July 1, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: September 30, 2027

## Service Requirements

Parks Canada invites contractors to provide foot passenger ferry service between the Town of Sidney and the Visitor Dock at Sidney Spit in Gulf Islands National Park Reserve. The ferry service will operate between May 15 and Labour Day each year of the contract. The transport of passengers via ferry will be an exclusive right for this location between May 15 and Labour Day for each year of the contract.

## Contract Duration and Extension

The period of the contract is for four years, with an option to extend by one additional year. For the 2024 season, the service will start at the date of contract (estimated July 2024).

## Indigenous Participation Plan

The Contractor should ensure provision of specific and agreed-upon benefits for Indigenous People and Indigenous Businesses in the Area of the Contract. This Invitation to Tender contains bid criteria to provide socioeconomic benefits to Indigenous communities within the area covered by the contract.

## Bid Submission Requirements

Bids must be submitted by fax or email to the designated contact. The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca](mailto:soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca). Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.

## Evaluation Criteria

The Contractor selection and Indigenous participation plan will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Technical merit
* Price

## Additional Requirements

National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act. Bidders responsible for implementing the contract must adhere to these requirements.

## Contact Information

For more information or to submit a bid, contact Mandelle Waddell at [mandelle.waddell@pc.gc.ca](mailto:mandelle.waddell@pc.gc.ca) or (403) 585-7724.
